page.description: Lock database file for batched changes.
page.discussion: The <TBL>.BATCH_BEGIN() method is placed at the start of a special batch operation for a particular table to improve the speed of the operation. All Change and Enter operations in the specified table pointer (&ltTBL>) that occur between the &ltTBL>.BATCH_BEGIN()and its corresponding <TBL>.BATCH_END(), are optimized. Alpha Anywhere optimizes data entry operations by either opening the table exclusively or by preventing write access to the file by other users.

section.title: Example
section.description: This script updates the Product table, both without and with the batch optimization.
section.example: dim tbl as P dim t1 as N dim t2 as N tbl = table.open("c:\A5\a_sports\product.dbf") t1 = toseconds(time()) tbl.fetch_first() while .NOT. tbl.fetch_eof() tbl.change_begin() tbl.qty = 0 tbl.change_end(.T.) tbl.fetch_next() end while t2 = toseconds(time()) trace.writeln("Trial 1 - Seconds elapsed:" + str(t2-t1)) t1 = toseconds(time()) tbl.batch_begin() tbl.fetch_first() while .NOT. tbl.fetch_eof() tbl.change_begin() tbl.qty = 1 tbl.change_end(.T.) tbl.fetch_next() end while tbl.batch_end() t2 = toseconds(time()) trace.writeln("Trial 2 - Seconds elapsed:" + str(t2-t1)) tbl.close()
